comments.comment: I am not sure if <denchmark-link:https://github.com/photoprism/photoprism/issues/36>#36</denchmark-link> is related. I bothered to raise this issue, and if this related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/photoprism/photoprism/issues/36>#36</denchmark-link> , please close this.

Maybe, not sure. Thanks for reporting! If you like, you can test if it only happens with specific files and if yes, attach one to this ticket or send it to us: <denchmark-link:mailto:hello@photoprism.org>hello@photoprism.org</denchmark-link>

Thank you, this is somewhat related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/photoprism/photoprism/issues/56>#56</denchmark-link> . PhotoPrism expects the filename to be canonical, that means it must have a certain length and must be unique. Otherwise the function might return null and this is what happened. Canonical names get created during import when moving the file to originals. So we need to find a way to index files with random names without needing a canonical name. Nothing I can fix quickly...
Fixed that AFAIK - let us know otherwise üëç
